title: Question 25
prompt: <u>Vince and his father were able to get the majority of the neighbors to vote for their proposal.</u>
description: Read the sentences and look at the underlined parts. Choose the answer that is written correctly for each underlined part.
feedback: The sentence is correct as it is. The difference between the answer choices is the verb. The correct verb is “were able.” It matches the plural subject and is in the correct tense, past tense. The verb “was able” is incorrect because it is singular. The verb “were abled” isn’t correct. “Abled” isn’t a correct form of the word “able.” The verb “had able” is also incorrect. It is similar to the form “had been able,” but it is not a correct verb form.
